title: Locker Sync Issue
description: Apps may appear installed in the Rebble store, but aren't actually in your locker. Your phone is out of sync with the servers
fix: Firstly, try rebooting your phone. If that doesn't work, see https://old.reddit.com/r/pebble/comments/ie51z2/slug/g2dk1mz

title: Getting started
description: You've not yet got setup with Rebble

title: Running the boot process
description: The boot process is the step during setup where we tell the Pebble app to point to Rebble servers. Re-running this often solves issues.
fix: Navigate to https://boot.rebble.io **on your phone**, follow the instructions.

title: Cancelling your subscription
description: Want to cancel your subscription? No problem.
fix: Select 'Cancel subscription' at https://auth.rebble.io/account/. If you don't see that option, you aren't logged in with the correct account, or you don't have an active subscription.

title: De-Rebble your Pebble app
description: You want to switch the Pebble app back to pointing at the dead Pebble servers. For some reason.

summary: downloading an app as a file from the store
title: Downloading a .pbw from the store
description: You want to download the .pbw file for a Pebble app or watchface
fix: Visit https://apps.rebble.io/?dev_settings=true in a browser. Find the app or face and select the new 'download .pbw' option at the bottom of the screen.

title: Sideloading a .pbw to your watch
description: You want to side load a .pbw file to your watch
fix: Download the .pbw on your phone. Open it in file manager and choose to 'open with Pebble'. On Android the Pebble app is often not an option, in which case using the Dropbox app or AmazeFileExplorer may work.

title: Replacing batteries
description: Your Pebble's current batteries are dying, and you want to fit new ones
fix: Batteries can be replaced on all models of Pebble. Not that it's harder on the PTR - you need a spot welder

title: Weather
description: Weather timeline pins require a rebble subscription. Weather for watchfaces works independent of this. Watchfaces may or may not work depending on the API they use.
fix: For a handy list of weather watchfaces confirmed to still be working, click the title of this message

title: Pebble SDK
description: There are many options for installing the SDK. For best results, a native install is suggested. There is also a docker image, as well as a full ubuntu-based VM. The SDK enables you to write watchfaces and apps in C or Javascript for all the pebble watches.
fix: Want to write Pebble apps? Install the SDK. Ask in #app-dev for help!

customfields.name: Ubuntu Virtual Machine with SDK installed:

title: If-This-Then-That Integration
description: You want to integrate IFTTT with Rebble Timeline

title: Donations
description: You want to donate to Rebble
fix: Currently Rebble does not accept direct donations, as cashflow isn't the blocker. If you're set on contributing financially, perhaps sign up for a subscription. Thanks!

title: Developer Portal
description: You want to submit an app to the Rebble appstore

title: Android App Download
description: The Android app is no longer available on the Google Play Store. You can still sideload it.

customfields.name: How to sideload an APK on Android:

title: Patched Android App
description: If you're experiencing issues with call controls on Android 9+. This patched version of the app _may_ help

title: iOS App Download
description: The iOS app is still available on the appstore, so there's no problem there. Yet.

title: Pebble 2 Hardware Issues
description: Due to the Pebble 2's rubbery disposition, the buttons can degrade and break after a few years of use.
fix:
Prevention is easier than fixing, so try to push evenly across the surface of the buttons on the P2. Use the flat of your thumb as opposed to your fingernail.
 If you do get button issues there are several options available to you.

customfields.name: Replacement Side Buttons
customfields.value: These 3d printed panels are the easiest fix. Just apply with some epoxy. https://www.shapeways.com/product/WBJBQUKJH/

customfields.name: Replacement LCD + Top cover
customfields.value: These are OEM parts from the pebble production line. It includes a front assembly, which replaces the button membranes as well as the LCD. Can be a little fiddily to re-assemble, but it is the cleanest fix. https://www.cloudmedia.com/?product=pebble-case-white-with-screen

customfields.name: 3D Printed Replacement Case
customfields.value: This 3d printed replacement housing requires a sacraficial OG pebble for it's buttons. It'll combine that with your Pebble 2's guts to bring it back to life. Take extra care to not damage the screen upon reassembly. https://www.shapeways.com/product/YTMBDJWTH

title: Screen Tearing
description: The OG and Steel are suceptible to screen tearing, where the screen gets black lines across it.
fix: The error is caused by the 'Zebra Strip' screen connector coming loose. You can either replace the zebra strip entierly or, sometimes, placing some folded paper or foam behind the strip fixes the issue. You will have to take the back off your watch, but for the Steel especially, it's not particularly intricate job. The OGs come in two varients, 'screw-sealed' and 'glue-sealed'. The glue-sealed versions are much harder to open up.

title: Requirements.txt failure
description: During the SDK install process, the step `pip install -r requirements.txt` fails.
fix: Edit the file requirements.txt and replace the URL on the last line with https://github.com/Willow-Systems/vagrant-pebble-sdk/raw/master/pypkjs-1.0.6.tar.gz. Save the file and retry the command that failed.

title: --no-site-packages error message
description: During the SDK install process, you get an error because of the flag `--no-site-packages`
fix: Repeat the failed command, but omit the --no-site-packages flag. It's deprecated so you don't actually need it.
